NAME: IN_DEGREE
NOTE: The number of hypernyms of a given concept.

NAME: OUT_DEGREE
NOTE: The number of hyponyms of a given concept.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Average score of AoA ratings on a scale from 1 to 11.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MIN
NOTE: The minimum age of acquisition indicated by participants.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MAX
NOTE: The maximum age of acquisition indicated by participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: The number of times the word appears in the corpus (i.e., on the total of 51 million words).

NAME: ENGLISH_CD
NOTE: The number of films in which the word appears (i.e., it has a maximum value of 8,388).

NAME: ENGLISH_SUBTITLE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: The word frequency per million words. It is the measure one would preferably use in ones manuscripts, because it is a standard measure of word frequency independent of the corpus size. It is given with two-digit precision, in order not to lose precision of the frequency counts.

NAME: ENGLISH_SUBTITLE_CD
NOTE: This  indicates in what percentage of the films the word appears.

NAME: ENGLISH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(FREQcount+1) and has four-digit precision. Calculating the log frequency on the raw frequencies is the most straightforward transformation, because it allows one to give words that are not in the corpus a value of 0. One can easily lose 5% of the variance explained by taking log(frequency per million # 1), because, in this case, one is not making much of a distinction between words with low frequencies. Similarly, adding values lower than 1 (e.g., #1E#10) is dangerous, because one may end up with a big gap between the words in oneÕs corpus and words for which one does not have a frequency measure (which will get a log value of #10). In addition, if one uses log(frequency per million), one will have negative values for words with a frequency lower than 1 per million, and one will have to enter negative values for missing words. The downside of using log10(FREQcount # 1) is that there is no intuitive relationship between Lg10WF and SUBTLWF (frequency per million).

NAME: ENGLISH_CD_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(CDcount+1) and has four-digit precision.

NAME: GERMAN_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the word as written in column 1 is encountered in the subtitle corpus.

NAME: GERMAN_SUBTITLE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the frequency per million based on CUMfreqcount (i.e., it equals CUMfreqcount / 25.399).

NAME: GERMAN_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This is log10(CUMfreqcount+1). It is the value to use when you want to match stimuli in various conditions. When a stimulus is not present in the corpus, lgSUBTLEX gets a value of 0.

NAME: ENGLISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: The mean concreteness rating on a 5-point rating scale going from abstract to concrete.

NAME: ENGLISH_DUNNO
NOTE: The number of persons indicating they did not know the word.

NAME: ENGLISH_POS
NOTE: The dominant part-of-speech tag of the word.

NAME: ENGLISH_KNOWN_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: The percentages of words known across 220,000 participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_PREVALENCE
NOTE: The word prevalence (number of people who know the word) across 220,000 participants.

NAME: CHINESE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: The number of times the word appears in the corpus.

NAME: CHINESE_FREQUENCY_PM
NOTE: The word frequency per million words. It is the measure one would preferably use in ones manuscripts, because it is a standard measure of word frequency independent of the corpus size. It is given with two-digit precision, in order not to lose precision of the frequency counts.

NAME: CHINESE_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(FREQcount+1) and has four-digit precision. Calculating the log frequency on the raw frequencies is the most straightforward transformation, because it allows one to give words that are not in the corpus a value of 0.

NAME: CHINESE_CD
NOTE: The number of films in which the word appears.

NAME: CHINESE_CD_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: This  indicates in what percentage of the films the word appears.

NAME: CHINESE_CD_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(CDcount+1) and has four-digit precision.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the word appears in the corpus.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_PM
NOTE: Word frequency per million  of subtitles.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: Log10 of subtitle word frequency.

NAME: FRENCH_SUBJECTIVE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: Subjective frequencies estimates were based on a 7-point rating scale.

NAME: FRENCH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Imageability estimates were based on a 7-point rating scale.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for all participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for male participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for female participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_YOUNG
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for young participants (with age above 32).

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_OLD
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for old participants (with age under 32).

NAME: ENGLISH_SER_MEAN
NOTE: Sensory experience ratings on a 7-point scale.

NAME: DUTCH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the word appears in the corpus.

NAME: DUTCH_CD
NOTE: This  is the number of films in which the word appears.

NAME: DUTCH_SUBTITLE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the WF per million words and has 4-digit precision.

NAME: DUTCH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This is a value based on log10(FREQcount+1) and with 4-digit precision.

NAME: DUTCH_SUBTITLE_CD
NOTE: This value indicates in what percent of the films the word appears, with 4-digit precision.

NAME: DUTCH_CD_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(CDcount +1) and has 4-digit precision.

NAME: ENGLISH_OCCURRENCES_TOTAL
NOTE: This is the number of valid age of acquisition-ratings of the word.

NAME: ENGLISH_OCCURRENCES_NUM
NOTE: This is the number of valid age of acquisition-ratings of the word, counting only numeric ratings, not 'don't know's.

NAME: ENGLISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean of the age of acquisition-ratings of the word. A total of 696,048 valid ratings, including 76,211 'don't know's, were collected from 1,729 inhabitants of the US.

NAME: ENGLISH_DUNNO
NOTE: This is the proportion of valid responses that are a rating and not a 'don't know'.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCY_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the valence ratings for each word obtained in the group of men on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCY_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the valence ratings for each word obtained in the group of women on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCY_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean of the valence ratings for each word obtained in the whole group on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the arousal ratings for each word obtained in the group of men on a 5-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the arousal ratings for each word obtained in the group of women on a 5-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean of the arousal ratings for each word obtained in the whole group on a 5-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the imageability ratings for each word obtained in the group of men on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the imageanility ratings for each word obtained in the group of women on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean of the imageability ratings for each word obtained in the whole group on a 7-point scale.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 9 Arousal is a measure of excitement versus calmness.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 9 Valence is a measure of value or worth.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 9 Dominance is a measure of the degree of control you feel.

NAME: ENGLISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Concreteness is a measure of how concrete or abstract something is. A word is CONCRETE if it represents something that exists in a definite physical form in the real world. In contrast, a word is ABSTRACT if it represents more of a concept or idea.

NAME: ENGLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Imageability is a measure of how easy or difficult something is to imagine.

NAME: ENGLISH_FAMILIARITY_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Familiarity is a measure of how familiar something is.

NAME: ENGLISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 A words age of acquisition is the age at which that word was initially learned.

NAME: ENGLISH_SEM_SIZE_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Size is a measure of somethings dimensions, magnitude, or extent. A word represents something BIG if it refers to things or concepts that are large. A word represents something SMALL if it refers to things or concepts that are little.

NAME: ENGLISH_GENDER_ASSOCIATION_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 A words gender is how strongly its meaning is associated with male or female behaviour.

NAME: SPANISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean value of valence across all participants. Participants rated the words on a 9-point scale.

NAME: SPANISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean value of arousal across all participants. Participants rated the words on a 9-point scale.

NAME: SENSES
NOTE: The relations to a sense for a given word.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on a 9-point scale across all participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on a 9-point scale across all participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on a 9-point scale across all participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on a 9-point scale across male participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on a 9-point scale across female participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on a 9-point scale across male participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on a 9-point scale across female participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on a 9-point scale across male participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on a 9-point scale across female participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_YOUNG
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on a 9-point scale across young participants (less than 30 years old).

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_OLD
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on a 9-point scale across old participants (greater than 30 years old).

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_YOUNG
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on a 9-point scale across young participants (less than 30 years old).

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_OLD
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on a 9-point scale across old participants (greater than 30 years old).

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_YOUNG
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on a 9-point scale across young participants (less than 30 years old).

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_OLD
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on a 9-point scale across old participants (greater than 30 years old).

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_HIGH
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on a 9-point scale across participants with a high education.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_LOW
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on a 9-point scale across participants with a low education.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_HIGH
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on a 9-point scale across participants with a high education.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_LOW
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on a 9-point scale across participants with a low education.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_HIGH
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on a 9-point scale across participants with a high education.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_LOW
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on a 9-point scale across participants with a low education.

NAME: ENGLISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean value of age-of-acquisition ratings on a 7-point scale.

NAME: ENGLISH_RT_MEAN
NOTE: The average RT to the stimulus (correct trials only).

NAME: ENGLISH_RT_ZSCORE
NOTE: The average standardized RT. Standardized RTs were calculated separately for all levels of participant, block, and lexicality (e.g., all RTs to correct word trials in block 1 by participant 1).

NAME: ENGLISH_ACCURACY_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: Average accuracy for the stimulus.

NAME: FRENCH_RT_MEAN
NOTE: The average RT to the stimulus (correct trials only).

NAME: FRENCH_RT_ZSCORE
NOTE: The average standardized RT. Standardized RTs were calculated separately for all levels of participant, block, and lexicality (e.g., all RTs to correct word trials in block 1 by participant 1).

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of AoA ratings on a 7-point Likert scale in which 1 corresponded to ages between 0 and 2 years old, 2 to ages between 2 and 4, and so on up to 7, which corresponded to ages over 12 years old.

NAME: SPANISH_RT_MEAN
NOTE: The average RT to the stimulus (correct trials only).

NAME: CHINESE_RT_MEAN
NOTE: Mean reaction time across participants.

NAME: CHINESE_RT_ZSCORE
NOTE: Mean standardized reaction time across participants.

NAME: CHINESE_STROKE
NOTE: Total number of strokes of the whole-word.

NAME: DUTCH_ACCURACY_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: Average accuracy for the stimulus.

NAME: DUTCH_PREVALENCE
NOTE: The word prevalence (number of people who know the word) across nearly 300,000 participants.

NAME: SPANISH_HAPPINESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale with 1 (not at all) and 5 (extremely) in the emotional category happiness.

NAME: SPANISH_DISGUST_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale with 1 (not at all) and 5 (extremely) in the emotional category disgust.

NAME: SPANISH_ANGER_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale with 1 (not at all) and 5 (extremely) in the emotional category anger.

NAME: SPANISH_FEAR_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale with 1 (not at all) and 5 (extremely) in the emotional category fear.

NAME: SPANISH_SADNESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale with 1 (not at all) and 5 (extremely) in the emotional category sadness.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Average score of AoA ratings. A predefined age scale was not used, and participants were required to directly enter the number corresponding to a particular age, in years.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MIN
NOTE: The minimum age of acquisition indicated by participants.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MAX
NOTE: The maximum age of acquisition indicated by participants.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_ZSCORE
NOTE: The average standardized AoA ratings.

NAME: POLISH_POS
NOTE: The dominant part of speech category.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_ORIGIN_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of origin ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_SIGNIFICANCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of significance ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of concreteness ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of imageability ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of age-of-acquisition ratings on SAM scale across all participants.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_ORIGIN_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of origin ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_SIGNIFICANCE_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of significance ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of concreteness ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of imageability ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_AOA_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value of age-of-acquisition ratings on SAM scale across female participants.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCE_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: POLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: POLISH_ORIGIN_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of origin ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: POLISH_SIGNIFICANCE_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of significance ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: POLISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of concreteness ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of imageability ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: POLISH_AOA_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value of age-of-acquisition ratings on SAM scale across male participants.

NAME: SPANISH_HAPPINESS_MEAN
NOTE: The mean value of the ratings for the discrete emotion happiness on a 5-point scale.

NAME: SPANISH_ANGER_MEAN
NOTE: The mean value of the ratings for the discrete emotion anger on a 5-point scale.

NAME: SPANISH_SADNESS_MEAN
NOTE: The mean value of the ratings for the discrete emotion sadness on a 5-point scale.

NAME: SPANISH_FEAR_MEAN
NOTE: The mean value of the ratings for the discrete emotion fear on a 5-point scale.

NAME: SPANISH_DISGUST_MEAN
NOTE: The mean value of the ratings for the discrete emotion disgust on a 5-point scale.

NAME: FAMILY_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times a translation for a given concept occurs across language families.

NAME: LANGUAGE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times a translation for a given concept occurs across language varieties.

NAME: WORD_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times a translation for a given concept occurs for a given word.

NAME: RANK
NOTE: This is the rank based on the degree.

NAME: COMMUNITY
NOTE: This is the community identifier.

NAME: CENTRAL_CONCEPT
NOTE: This is the most central node in each of the community clusters in CLICS3.

NAME: DEGREE
NOTE: This is the unweighted and weighted degree for each node.

NAME: WEIGHTED_FAMILY_DEGREE
NOTE: This is the weighted degree for each node across language families.

NAME: WEIGHTED_LANGUAGE_DEGREE
NOTE: This is the weighted degree for each node across language varieties.

NAME: POLISH_HAPPINESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category happiness.

NAME: POLISH_ANGER_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category anger.

NAME: POLISH_SADNESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category sadness.

NAME: POLISH_FEAR_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category fear.

NAME: POLISH_DISGUST_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category disgust.

NAME: POLISH_HAPPINESS_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category happiness (only female participants).

NAME: POLISH_ANGER_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category anger (only female participants).

NAME: POLISH_SADNESS_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category sadness(only female participants).

NAME: POLISH_FEAR_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category fear (only female participants).

NAME: POLISH_DISGUST_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category disgust (only female participants).

NAME: POLISH_HAPPINESS_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category happiness (only male participants).

NAME: POLISH_ANGER_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category anger (only male participants).

NAME: POLISH_SADNESS_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category sadness(only male participants).

NAME: POLISH_FEAR_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category fear (only male participants).

NAME: POLISH_DISGUST_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category disgust (only male participants).

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the spoken word appears in the corpus.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_PM
NOTE: The frequency per million for spoken words.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: The log10 of spoken word frequency.

NAME: ENGLISH_AUDITORY_MEAN
NOTE: Auditory strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by hearing.

NAME: ENGLISH_GUSTATORY_MEAN
NOTE: Gustatory strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by tasting.

NAME: ENGLISH_HAPTIC_MEAN
NOTE: Haptic strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by feeling through touch.

NAME: ENGLISH_INTEROCEPTIVE_MEAN
NOTE: Interoceptive strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by sensations inside the body.

NAME: ENGLISH_OLFACTORY_MEAN
NOTE: Olfactory strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by smelling.

NAME: ENGLISH_VISUAL_MEAN
NOTE: Visual strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by seeing.

NAME: ENGLISH_FOOT_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Foot action strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the foot / leg.

NAME: ENGLISH_HAND_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Hand action strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the hand / arm.

NAME: ENGLISH_HEAD_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Head action strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the head excluding mouth.

NAME: ENGLISH_MOUTH_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Mouth action strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the mouth / throat.

NAME: ENGLISH_TORSO_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Torso action strength: mean rating (0–5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the torso.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_STRENGTH_MAX
NOTE: Perceptual strength in the dominant modality (i.e., highest strength rating across six perceptual modalities).

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_STRENGTH_AGGREGATED
NOTE: Aggregated perceptual strength in all modalities where the influence of weaker modalities is attenuated, calculated as Minkowski distance (with exponent 3) of the 6-dimension vector of perceptual strength from the origin.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Modality exclusivity of the concept; the extent to which a concept is experienced though a single perceptual modality (0–1, typically expressed as %), calculated as the range of perceptual strength values divided by their sum.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_DOMINANT
NOTE: Perceptual modality through which the concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest perceptual strength rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_STRENGTH_MAX
NOTE: Action strength in the dominant effector (i.e., highest strength rating across five action effectors).

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_STRENGTH_AGGREGATED
NOTE: Aggregated action strength in all effectors where the influence of weaker effectors is attenuated, calculated as Minkowski distance (with exponent 3) of the 5-dimension vector of action strength from the origin.

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Effector exclusivity of the concept; the extent to which a concept is experienced though a single action effector (0–1, typically expressed as %), calculated as the range of action strength values divided by their sum .

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_DOMINANT
NOTE: Action effector through which the concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest action strength rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_STRENGTH_MAX
NOTE: Sensorimotor strength in the dominant dimension (i.e., highest strength rating across 11 sensorimotor dimensions).

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_STRENGTH_AGGREGATED
NOTE: Aggregated sensorimotor strength in all dimensions where the influence of weaker dimensions is attenuated, calculated as Minkowski distance (with exponent 3) of the 11-dimension vector of sensorimotor strength from the origin.

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Sensorimotor exclusivity of the concept; the extent to which a concept is experienced though a single sensorimotor dimension (0–1, typically expressed as %), calculated as the range of sensorimotor strength values divided by their sum .

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_DOMINANT
NOTE: Sensorimotor dimension through which the concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest sensorimotor strength rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_KNOWN_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: Percentage of participants (0–1) in perceptual strength norming who knew the concept well enough to provide valid ratings, calculated as N_known.perceptual divided by List_N.perceptual.

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_KNOWN_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: Percentage of participants (0–1) in action strength norming who knew the concept well enough to provide valid ratings, calculated as N_known.action divided by List_N.action.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Average age of participants in perceptual strength norming who completed the item list featuring the concept (i.e., who were presented with the concept for rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Average age of participants in action strength norming who completed the item list featuring the concept (i.e., who were presented with the concept for rating).

NAME: TURKISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 9-point Likert SAM scale for valence.

NAME: TURKISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 9-point Likert SAM for arousal.

NAME: TURKISH_HAPPINESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category happiness.

NAME: TURKISH_ANGER_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category anger.

NAME: TURKISH_SADNESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category sadness.

NAME: TURKISH_FEAR_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category fear.

NAME: TURKISH_DISGUST_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category disgust.

NAME: TURKISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for concreteness.

NAME: COMPLEXITY
NOTE: This is the intuitive complexity of the word on a scale from 1 to 7 based on a survey with 240 valid participants.

NAME: MEAN_SWISS_GERMAN

NAME: MEAN_SECOND_L1
NOTE: Mean of whether children understand the word for this concept in their other native language.

NAME: MEAN_TRANSLATIONAL_EQUIV
NOTE: Mean of whether children understand the word for this concept in both languages.

NAME: MEAN_CONCEP_VOCAB
NOTE: Mean of whether children understand the word for this concept in any of their native languages.

NAME: KNOWN_PROPORTION
NOTE: Proportion of participants that were familiar with the meaning of the noun (0-100%).

NAME: AUDITORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by hearing.

NAME: GUSTATORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by tasting.

NAME: HAPTIC_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by feeling through touch.

NAME: OLFACTORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by smelling.

NAME: VISUAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by seeing.

NAME: DOMINANT_MODALITY
NOTE: Modality through which noun concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest strength rating).

NAME: EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Extent to which noun concept is experienced though a single perceptual modality (0 – 100%), calculated as range of strength values divided by their sum.

NAME: DOMINANT_MODALITY
NOTE: Modality through which noun concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest strength rating).

NAME: VISUAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by seeing.

NAME: HAPTIC_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by feeling through touch.

NAME: AUDITORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by hearing.

NAME: GUSTATORY_MEAN
NOTE: Standard deviation of gustatory strength ratings.

NAME: OLFACTORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by tasting.

NAME: EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Extent to which verbs concept is experienced though a single perceptual modality (0 – 100%), calculated as range of strength values divided by their sum.

NAME: FAMILARITY
NOTE: The values represent the proportion of participants who believed that they knew the word’s meaning.

NAME: VISUAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by seeing.

NAME: HAPTIC_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by feeling through touch.

NAME: AUDITORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by hearing.

NAME: OLFACTORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by smelling.

NAME: GUSTATORY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean rating (0-5) of how strongly noun concept is experienced by tasting.

NAME: DOMINANT_MODALITY
NOTE: Modality through which property is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest strength rating).

NAME: EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Extent to which property is experienced though a single perceptual modality (0%–100%), calculated as range of strength values divided by their sum.

NAME: WORD_LENGTH
NOTE: Number of letters in property word.

NAME: SEMANTIC_CATEGORY
NOTE: One hundred words were selected per category from the study by [Hernández-Muñoz (2002)](:bib:Hernandez2002), which is an exploration of the common vocabulary shared by the Spanish community of Cuenca. The first 100 words with the highest LA scores in each category were selected for the present study.

NAME: TYPICALITY
NOTE: Typicality refers to the degree to which a concept (e.g., dog) is representative of a given category (e.g., animals).

NAME: FAMILIARITY
NOTE: The participants were asked to estimate the degree to which they thought about or came into contact with a concept, using a 7-point scale (from 1  less than once a month to 7  many times a day).

NAME: AOA
NOTE: 50 monolingual native Spanish speakers with a mean age of 23 years (range, 18–42) were asked to indicate the age at which they believed they had first learned each word.

NAME: IMAGEABILITY
NOTE: Ratings were obtained on a scale ranging from 1 (very difficult to arouse a mental image) to 7 (very easy to arouse a mental image).

NAME: LEXICAL_AVAILABILITY
NOTE: LA denotes the readiness with which a word is produced as a member of a given category. The LA values presented here were taken from [Hernández-Muñoz (2002)](:bib:Hernandez2002), who collected written category generation data from 117 Spanish native speakers 17 to 18 years of age.

NAME: FREQUENCY
NOTE: Frequency values were taken from [Alameda and Cuetos (1995)](:bib:Alameda1995), which is a corpus of written Spanish text comprising 2 million words.

NAME: SEMANTIC_CATEGORY
NOTE: A group of 20 participants (15 female, 5 male) took part in the exemplar generation study. Participants were provided with a booklet containing a list of 11 category labels (VEGETABLES, VEHICLES, TOOLS, CLOTHING, FURNITURE, SPORTS, BIRDS, FRUITS, ANIMALS, PROFESSIONS, and MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS1). Each category label was presented on a separate sheet of paper. Participants were asked by written instructions to write down as many examples as they could think of for each semantic category.

NAME: TYPICALITY_MEAN
NOTE: The participants were asked to rate the typicality of the category exemplar on a 7-point scale from 1 (very good example of the category/typical) to 7 (bad example of the category/atypical)

NAME: AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were asked to indicate on a 7-point scale when they thought they had learned the words.

NAME: FAMILIARITY_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were asked to estimate the degree to which they thought about or came in contact with a concept, using a 5-point scale ranging from 1 (very unfamiliar) to 5 (very familiar).

NAME: AOA_MEAN
NOTE: For each word, the participants were asked to enter the age (in years) at which they thought they had learned the word.

NAME: AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were asked to indicate the degree to which a word refers to something very passive/calm (1) or very active/arousing (7), and to something very weak/submissive (1) or very strong/dominant (7) for arousal and dominance, respectively.

NAME: CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: Participants rated each word’s level of abstraction on a 7-point scale ranging from very abstract (1) to very concrete (7).

NAME: DOMINANCE_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were asked to indicate the degree to which a word refers to something very passive/calm (1) or very active/arousing (7), and to something very weak/submissive (1) or very strong/dominant (7) for arousal and dominance, respectively.

NAME: FAMILIARITY_MEAN
NOTE: Participants rated how familiar they were with each word in the list by indicating how often they had encountered or used the word. Ratings were performed on 7-point scales.

NAME: IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Participants rated each word’s capacity to arouse a mental image by indicating how easily they could form a mental image of the word on a 7-point scale with the ends labeled difficult (1) and easy (7).

NAME: VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Participants rated the valence of each word by indicating on a 7-point scale the extent to which it evoked a very bad (1) or a very good (7) feeling.

NAME: INSTRENGTH
NOTE: The in-strength si of a word i reflects the number of links that go into the node representing the word in the word association network and as such provides an indication of the word’s importance in the mental lexicon. The variables in-strength and betweenness were taken from the Small World of Words project (https://smallworldofword.org/), a large-scale study that aims to build a map of the human lexicon in the major languages of the world (including Dutch) using word association data [(De Deyne et al. 2019)](:bib:DeDeyne2019).

NAME: BETWEENNESS
NOTE: Betweenness is another indicator of the centrality of a node in the network. It takes the global structure of the word association network more in account than in-strength does in that it captures how often a node is located on the shortest path between other nodes in the network. The variables in-strength and betweenness were taken from the Small World of Words project (https://smallworldofword.org/), a large-scale study that aims to build a map of the human lexicon in the major languages of the world (including Dutch) using word association data [(De Deyne et al. 2019)](:bib:DeDeyne2019).

NAME: WORD_TYPE
NOTE: The list includes deverbal compounds, nouns and verbs.

NAME: SUBJECTIVE_FREQ_MEAN
NOTE: Ratings were collected from 102 native speakers of Spanish on the subjective frequency of occurrence of 330 Spanish words.

NAME: COLOR_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were randomly assigned to rate words on a scale from 1 to 8 in only one of the seven dimensions (color, motion, sound, smell, taste, graspability and pain) for the 250 words in a given set.

NAME: MOTION_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were randomly assigned to rate words on a scale from 1 to 8 in only one of the seven dimensions (color, motion, sound, smell, taste, graspability and pain) for the 250 words in a given set.

NAME: GRASP_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were randomly assigned to rate words on a scale from 1 to 8 in only one of the seven dimensions (color, motion, sound, smell, taste, graspability and pain) for the 250 words in a given set.

NAME: PAIN_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were randomly assigned to rate words on a scale from 1 to 8 in only one of the seven dimensions (color, motion, sound, smell, taste, graspability and pain) for the 250 words in a given set.

NAME: SOUND_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were randomly assigned to rate words on a scale from 1 to 8 in only one of the seven dimensions (color, motion, sound, smell, taste, graspability and pain) for the 250 words in a given set.

NAME: TASTE_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were randomly assigned to rate words on a scale from 1 to 8 in only one of the seven dimensions (color, motion, sound, smell, taste, graspability and pain) for the 250 words in a given set.

NAME: SMELL_MEAN
NOTE: Participants were randomly assigned to rate words on a scale from 1 to 8 in only one of the seven dimensions (color, motion, sound, smell, taste, graspability and pain) for the 250 words in a given set.

NAME: VALENCE_ALL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean valence values for all participants. The valence and arousal scales from the paperand-pencil version of the 9-point SAM scale (Lang, 1980).

NAME: AROUSAL_ALL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean arousal values for all participants. The valence and arousal scales from the paperand-pencil version of the 9-point SAM scale (Lang, 1980).

NAME: VALENCE_MALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean valence values for male participants. The valence and arousal scales from the paperand-pencil version of the 9-point SAM scale (Lang, 1980).

NAME: AROUSAL_MALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean arousal values for male participants. The valence and arousal scales from the paperand-pencil version of the 9-point SAM scale (Lang, 1980).

NAME: VALENCE_FEMALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean valence values for female participants. The valence and arousal scales from the paperand-pencil version of the 9-point SAM scale (Lang, 1980).

NAME: AROUSAL_FEMALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean arousal values for female participants. The valence and arousal scales from the paperand-pencil version of the 9-point SAM scale (Lang, 1980).

NAME: DEFINITION
NOTE: Definition of the meanings in the Wordsmyth dictionary.

NAME: SUBJECTIVE_FREQ
NOTE: Mean subjective frequency ratings of the meanings.

NAME: DOMINANCE_SCORE
NOTE: Dominance score (B), first calculated for each subject and then averaged across subjects (0 - completely balanced, 1 - completely unbalanced homonym).

NAME: NUMBER_WORD_SENSE_WORDSMYTH
NOTE: Number of word senses in the Wordsmyth Online Dictionary [(Parks et al., 1998)](:bib:Parks1998).

NAME: AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Valence rating on a 9-point Likert scale by 960 university students.

NAME: CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: Arousal rating on a 9-point Likert scale 960 university students.

NAME: FAMILIARITY_MEAN
NOTE: Concreteness rating on a 9-point Likert scale 960 university students.

NAME: FAMILIARITY_MEAN
NOTE: Familiarity rating on a 9-point Likert scale 960 university students.

NAME: IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Imageability rating on a 9-point Likert scale 960 university students.

NAME: CONTEXT_AVAILABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Context availability rating on a 9-point Likert scale 960 university students.

NAME: PEN_STROKES
NOTE: Total number of strokes of the whole-word.

NAME: ICONICITY
NOTE: 40 U.S. adults with no knowledge of Chinese were given an English word or short phrase together with two Chinese characters and were asked which character matched the meaning of the English word.

NAME: PICTURABILITY
NOTE: 31 English speaking students were shown the English translations of Chinese characters used in the experiment and had to rate each translation on a 7-point scale to indicate the extent to which the concept could be expressed easily in a simple black-on-white line drawing or diagram.

NAME: RATE
NOTE: Stability (rate of lexical change) measured for concepts based on a sample from Indo-European languages.

NAME: RANK
NOTE: Ranks for the 200 basic concepts, which are retrieved from the calculation of evolutionary rates from phylogenetic analyses on the database by Dyen et al (1992).

NAME: GERMAN_HAPPINESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale in the emotional category happiness.

NAME: GERMAN_ANGER_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale in the emotional category anger.

NAME: GERMAN_SADNESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale in the emotional category sadness.

NAME: GERMAN_FEAR_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale in the emotional category fear.

NAME: GERMAN_DISGUST_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses a 5-point scale in the emotional category disgust.

NAME: GERMAN_EMOTION_DOMINANT
NOTE: A more conservative classification criterion was applied, assigning words to a specific discrete emotion category only in cases in which the averaged rating in one discrete emotion was more than one standard deviation higher than in any other discrete emotion.

NAME: POLISH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the word appears in the corpus.

NAME: POLISH_CD
NOTE: This  is the number of films in which the word appears.

NAME: POLISH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This is a value based on log10(FREQcount+1).

NAME: POLISH_CD_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(CDcount +1).

NAME: DUTCH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean valence values for all participants (224 students) on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean arousal values for all participants (224 students) on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_VALENCE_MALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean valence values for male participants on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_AROUSAL_MALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean arousal values for male participants on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_VALENCE_FEMALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean valence values for female participants on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_AROUSAL_FEMALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean arousal values for female participants on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Mean age-of-acquisition values for all participants (224 students) on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_AOA_MALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean age-of-acquisition values for male participants on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: DUTCH_AOA_FEMALE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean age-of-acquisition values for female participants on a 7-point Likert scale.

NAME: TRANSLATION_COUNT
NOTE: This value represents the number of languages in which a word occurred. It is the relative coverage of a target concept in 1895 bilingual dictionaries.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of valence ratings based on best-worst scaling. The participants were presented with four words at a time (4-tuples) and asked to select the word with the highest valence and the word with the lowest valence.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of arousal ratings based on best-worst scaling. The participants were presented with four words at a time (4-tuples) and asked to select the word with the highest arousal and the word with the lowest arousal.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of dominance ratings based on best-worst scaling. The participants were presented with four words at a time (4-tuples) and asked to select the word with the highest dominance and the word with the lowest dominance.

NAME: ENGLISH_EMOTION_DOMINANT
NOTE: The most dominant emotion based on pointwise mutual information (PMI) with PMI > 1 in the Hashtag Emotion Corpus [(Mohammad 2012)](:bib:Mohammad2012).

NAME: ENGLISH_EMOTION_INTENSITY
NOTE: Mean value of emotion intensity based on best-worst scaling. The participants were presented with four words at a time (4-tuples) and asked to select the word that conveys the highest emotion intensity and the word that conveys the lowest emotion intensity.

NAME: ENGLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of imageability ratings based on a 7-point scale.

NAME: ENGLISH_FAMILIARITY_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value of familiarity ratings based on a 7-point scale.

NAME: FRENCH_EMOTION_POLARITY
NOTE: Polarity associated with a word (positive/negative) based on a sentiment analysis of texts.

NAME: FRENCH_JOY_ASSOCIATION
NOTE: The emotion associated with the word based on a sentiment analysis of texts: 1 (associated) and 0 (not associated).

NAME: FRENCH_FEAR_ASSOCIATION
NOTE: The emotion associated with the word based on a sentiment analysis of texts: 1 (associated) and 0 (not associated).

NAME: FRENCH_SADNESS_ASSOCIATION
NOTE: The emotion associated with the word based on a sentiment analysis of texts: 1 (associated) and 0 (not associated).

NAME: FRENCH_ANGER_ASSOCIATION
NOTE: The emotion associated with the word based on a sentiment analysis of texts: 1 (associated) and 0 (not associated).

NAME: FRENCH_SURPRISE_ASSOCIATION
NOTE: The emotion associated with the word based on a sentiment analysis of texts: 1 (associated) and 0 (not associated).

NAME: FRENCH_DISGUST_ASSOCIATION
NOTE: The emotion associated with the word based on a sentiment analysis of texts: 1 (associated) and 0 (not associated).

NAME: LGC
NOTE: The stability measure for a concept is called local-global distance correlation (lgc).

NAME: INF
NOTE: The average information content (inf) is the measure for basicness.

NAME: RANK
NOTE: The rank is based on the suitability of a given word for inclusion in Swadesh-style lists of basic stable concepts.

NAME: SEMANTIC_CLASS
NOTE: The semantic field of a given word. The words are grouped into 17 broader classes (amphibian or reptile, appliance, bird, building, clothing, container, fruit, furniture, ground_mammal, insect, musical_instrument, tool, tree, vegetable, vehicle, water_animal, weapon).

NAME: TYPICAL_ATTRIBUTE
NOTE: This is a list of adjectives expressing an attribute of the concept.

NAME: COHYPONYMY
NOTE: This is a list of nouns that are a co-hyponym (coordinate) of the concept, i.e., they belong to the same (narrowly or broadly defined) semantic class.

NAME: TYPICAL_EVENT
NOTE: This is a list of verbs referring to an action/activity/happening/event the concept is involved in or is performed by/with the concept.

NAME: HYPERONYM
NOTE: This is a list of nouns that are a hypernym of the concept.

NAME: MERONYM
NOTE: This is a list of nouns referring to a part/component/organ/member of the concept, or something that the concept contains or is made of.

NAME: RANDOM_ADJECTIVE
NOTE: This is a list of adjectives related to the concept. Random relata were chosen to approximately match the frequency of occurrence of the true relata (frequencies computed on the concatenated WaCkypedia_EN and ukWaC corpora.

NAME: RANDOM_NOUN
NOTE: This is a list of nouns related to the concept. Random relata were chosen to approximately match the frequency of occurrence of the true relata (frequencies computed on the concatenated WaCkypedia_EN and ukWaC corpora.

NAME: RANDOM_VERB
NOTE: This is a list of verbs related to the concept. Random relata were chosen to approximately match the frequency of occurrence of the true relata (frequencies computed on the concatenated WaCkypedia_EN and ukWaC corpora.

NAME: SEMANTIC_CATEGORY
NOTE: This is the semantic key (semkey) which is a unique identification string given to each semantic category, with the semkey taking the form of a string x, x.x, x.x.x, or x.x.x.x. The first digit in the semkey indicates the broad semantic category to which it belongs, as described above, where '1' is used for 'Body Parts', '2' is used for 'Animals (and Animal Verbs)', and so on. Each of the following 'x's in the semkey (x.x, x.x.x, etc.) denotes a more fine-grained semantic categorization; for example, 1.5 is 'Limbs, Joints, & Body Measures', 1.5.1 is 'Hand, Arm, Wing', and 1.5.1.1 is 'Hand'.

NAME: WEIGHTED_DEGREE
NOTE: This is the weighted degree we computed from the association data (the sum of all association weights per word).

NAME: DEGREE
NOTE: This is the degree we computed from the association data (the number of association edges per word).
